bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 6 (Monday, January 11, 2021)][House][Pages H123-H124]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. LEE of California:H.R. 255.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H124]]This bill is enacted pursuant to the power granted toCongress under Article I of the United States Constitutionand its subsequent amendments, and further clarified andinterpreted by the Supreme Court of the United States.

latestAction.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 63.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.fullName: Del. San Nicolas, Michael F. Q. [D-GU-At Large]

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text:
Repeal of the Authorization for Use of Military Force

This bill repeals the Authorization for Use of Military Force signed into law September 18, 2001.

bill.title: Repeal of the Authorization for Use of Military Force

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
